availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Virginia native. Married Elizabeth Carlisle. Common schools commissioner in Kenton County in 1840. Represented Kenton County in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1841, 1847, and 1851-1853. Farmer in Kenton County in 1860. Owned four enslaved people in 1860. Arrested by order of Major General Stephen G. Burbridge in late July 1864 and held in jail in Louisville.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 171. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 4. Teresa Wilkins, "Kenton Co. School District" in The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 509. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, _Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 137, 193. Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 421. Find A Grave, "Robert M Carlisle (1807-1875)," Memorial # 70391113, (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=CARL&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSsr=481&GRid=70391113&) (Accessed March 27, 2017).
